docs.snippet: A stadium worker who accused the security director of the Baltimore Ravens of groping her after a game took the stand during the first day of trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: A stadium worker who accused the security director of the Baltimore Ravens of groping her after a game took the stand during the first day of trial.

headline.main: Accuser of Ravens Security Director Testifies at His Trial
headline.print_headline: Accuser of Ravens Security Director Testifies at His Trial

docs.snippet: A man suspected of killing a retired dentist, taking three men hostage and wounding two deputies was likely traveling a section of the famed Pacific Crest Trail to elude searchers during an 18-day manhunt, authorities said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man suspected of killing a retired dentist, taking three men hostage and wounding two deputies was likely traveling a section of the famed Pacific Crest Trail to elude searchers during an 18-day manhunt, authorities said Monday.

headline.main: Target of Manhunt Used Pacific Crest Trail to Elude Capture
headline.print_headline: Target of Manhunt Used Pacific Crest Trail to Elude Capture

docs.snippet: New Age retreats that offer yoga, meditation and spa treatments are cropping up in Assisi, Italy, a spot popular with Catholic pilgrims for centuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: New Age retreats that offer yoga, meditation and spa treatments are cropping up in Assisi, Italy, a spot popular with Catholic pilgrims for centuries.
docs.abstract: Assisi Journal; town of Assisi, Italy, has begun drawing new types of pilgrims in addition to Christians who have long visited hometown of St Francis; many new visitors are not Catholic, and many are influenced by Indian spiritual traditions; some are interested in luxury services, which businesses in town have been increasingly providing.

headline.main: In St. Francis’ Hometown, a New Kind of Pilgrim
headline.print_headline: A New Kind of Pilgrim in St. Francis’ Hometown

docs.snippet: Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was voted out of office in January, is trying to become prime minister, but opponents are determined to bury his political hopes once and for all....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was voted out of office in January, is trying to become prime minister, but opponents are determined to bury his political hopes once and for all.
docs.abstract: Sri Lanka's former Pres Mahinda Rajapaksa puts forth optimistic outlook that voters will return him to power as prime minister in coming parliamentary election, despite myriad indications of his diminished political stature; sitting Pres Maithripala Sirisena has stated explicitly that Rajapaksa is unfit for office.

headline.main: Comeback Hopes Dim for Mahinda Rajapaksa, Sri Lanka’s Ex-President
headline.print_headline: Comeback Hopes Dim for Sri Lanka’s Ex-President
